title: The UK's most decadent party manors - still available to rent for New Year's Eve
text:
This glorious Grade I-listed converted Tudor Hall (plus its Gatehouse and The Cottage) built in 1478 by Sir James Hobart, Attorney General to Henry VII, is still one of the most historically significant country houses in Norfolk.

It sleeps 25 people in 13 elegant bedrooms (with 11 bathrooms). A year-round focal point (but particularly handy in winter) is the cosy 38-foot kitchen-dining room with its four-oven Aga. Other highlights include a comfortable music room with a Steck Mini Grand Piano and topiary-filled gardens to explore on New...
description: Looking for somewhere fabulous to spend New Year’s Eve with your favourite people?
